replies.msg:
GdS: Two LaLiga clubs want Milan striker; €25m price tag set

AC Milan striker Andre Silva may have the choice of two destinations in Spain this summer, if the latest reports are to be believed.

The Portugal international is one player who is seemingly surplus to requirements, with reports suggesting he is ‘destined’ to leave Milan before the window shuts.

Silva was on the verge of a move to Monaco, but it ended up falling through due to financial disagreements, but other destinations are still a possibility.

Valencia have emerged as the latest potential suitors for the 23-year-old, as they look to replace the Atletico-bound Rodrigo Moreno, with speculation stating a sale to them could help push through Milan’s move for Angel Correa.

However it is not just Valencia who are interested in Silva: La Gazzetta dello Sport report that Espanyol are also keen on the idea of signing the former Porto man.

It was reported by the paper earlier on Thursday that Milan’s stance is clear: they will not accept a penny less than €25m for Silva.

replies.msg: Maldini is expected to fly to Madrid at the beginning of next week to meet Atletico to try to finalize the Angel Correa deal. He will also meet Real Madrid to discuss Mariano Diaz who is proposed to the Rossoneri and could arrive for a feasible figure [GdS]

Real Madrid and Milan will apparently meet again soon and a profile that could be discussed is Mariano Díaz, even though Ángel Correa remains the number one target for the attack.

The transfer market ends in less than two and a half weeks. Milan have already signed five new players but there will still be some movements until September 2.

According to a story written by Alessandra Bocci of La Gazzetta dello Sport, Real Madrid and Milan have scheduled a meeting for the last week of the transfer market. Paolo Maldini, Zvonimir Boban and Frederic Massara already met Real earlier this summer and the meeting resulted in Theo Hernández joining the club.

The Los Blancos will have some players surplus to requirements by the end of the market and Milan can take advantage of this situation. While the likes of ModriÄ‡, James, Isco and Bale are virtually unattainable due to their cost, a profile that could be discussed is that of Mariano Díaz.

La Gazzetta claims that Real Madrid could offer the striker to Milan. Mariano, 26, has no space at Real Madrid and has failed to convince coach Zinedine Zidane since returning to Madrid in 2018. He’s already been stripped of his #7 jersey (given to Eden Hazard) and therefore is likely to be on the move. Mariano would give Milan another option up front, and be an alternative to Krzysztof PiÄ…tek.

In any case, the number one target of the Rossoneri for the attack remains Ángel Correa of Atlético Madrid. The offer of the Diavolo remains €38m plus bonuses and the deal is stuck for now.

Giampaolo to Sky: “It’s impossible to look brilliant in friendlies. It’s not what I care about. When I said that we need time it wasn’t to look for excuses but because I know how it works.”

Giampaolo: “Those who started the game are the ones who give me more guarantees. I trained Duarte, Paqueta, Kessie and Bennacer a very few times. They are quality players but still have to learn the movements collectively. Who started training over a month ago has to improve.”

“After all, I had one session with Rafael Leao, none with Ismael Bennacer, Leo Duarte had three. There are players who have quality, but don’t know what’s happening in the collective thought process because they arrived late, like Lucas Paqueta and Franck Kessie.
Giampaolo also had an intriguing explanation for Krzysztof Piatek’s pre-season struggles.

“The tests show he feels pain and fatigue a lot more than the others, so naturally he takes longer to shake off the strain of pre-season training regimes.

Milan have asked Tottenham Hotspur if they can take Serge Aurier on loan with option to buy, according to French reports.

Soccerlink claim the Rossoneri are prepared to sign the Ivory Coast international, who had been close to San Siro before opting for Spurs in 2017.

The right-back struggled to make an impact in England and is proving to be an expensive weight on their wage bill.

With the Premier League transfer deadline already passed, a sale abroad is the only option and Milan are open to giving Aurier a new lease of life in Serie A.

Milan would prefer it to be a loan with option to buy, but naturally Tottenham Hotspur want some guarantees after paying €25m to sign him from Paris Saint-Germain.

replies.msg:
Patrick Cutrone claims he was ousted because Milan ‘prefer foreigners’ and sees ‘similarities’ between Wolverhampton Wanderers and European rivals Torino.

Cutrone recently joined Wolves in a €22m deal and is currently preparing for a Europa League playoff tie with Toro, whom he knows well from his time at Milan.

“My first impressions have been excellent,” he told Gazzetta dello Sport.

“I was received very well and I’ve already settled in. I didn’t like living in a hotel, so I’ve found a house where my best friend has been keeping me company.

“It’ll be tough against Torino. They’re a good team and there are several similarities between us and them: passionate fans, character, pride, a sense of belonging.”

Despite being a Rossoneri youth product and potential Italy No 9, the club cashed in on the 21-year-old and replaced him with Portuguese forward Rafael Leao.

“It’s always the same story: foreigners are preferred to us. For us twenty-somethings, it’s hard, but in any case I’d like to emphasise something: I’ll always be grateful to Milan for what they gave me.”
ç‰™å‘Š

replies.msg:
AC Milan have finally had an offer accepted for Atletico Madrid’s Angel Correa, according to the latest reports in Italy.

The transfer saga surrounding Correa has dragged on for weeks now as Milan and Atletico struggle to come to an agreement over a fee.

It has been claimed that distance between the two sides remains over transfer fee, despite the fact that the player reportedly wants the move and personal terms have already been agreed.

Reports earlier on Wednesday suggested that Paolo Maldini and Boban were preparing one final push to try and close the gap between Milan’s offer (€40m plus bonuses) and Atleti’s demands (€50-55m).

However, according to a report from Sportmediaset (via Calciomercato.com), the Rojiblancos have accepted Milan’s offer of €42million plus 30% future resale percentage.

In order for the white smoke, however, the sale of André Silva to Valencia and the transfer of Rodrigo from Valencia to Atletico is needed, the report claims.

Roma are in negotiations to take Nikola Kalinic from Atletico Madrid, on loan with option to buy, claim Sky Sport Italia.

The former Fiorentina and Milan striker is already 31 years old and on the outskirts of the Atleti project after his €14.5m move last summer.

A new forward is required, as Gregoire Defrel is on the verge of a transfer to Sampdoria, while Patrik Schick is wanted by RB Leipzig and Schalke 04.

According to Sky Sport Italia transfer expert Gianluca Di Marzio, Roma have targeted Kalinic as an understudy to Edin Dzeko and Coach Paulo Fonseca has already given the all-clear.

The Croatia international is also eager for a return to Serie A and it would be a low-cost deal, on loan with option to buy.

AC Milan could disrupt Napoli’s plot to sign Mauro Icardi from Inter, according to renowned journalist Paolo Condo.

Icardi is seemingly destined to leave the Rossoneri’s city rivals this summer, with the Nerazzurri having already splashed out over €70m on his replacement Romelu Lukaku.

Shock reports earlier in the week linked Milan with a move for Icardi amid reports that the player wants to remain in Milan.

Inter chief Beppe Marotta is apparently not keen on reinforcing a direct competitor for the Scudetto, such as Juventus and Napoli who have shown interest as well, so a sale to Milan could help fix the issues of both parties.

Condo has provided his take on the situation to Radio 24, suggesting that Milan could swoop late and land the Argentine.

“Napoli will probably let the ultimatum [for Icardi’s sale] expire and will wait for the Argentine, because the opportunity to let him work with Ancelotti is too tempting,” Condo said.

“The thing that could spoil is an offer from Milan, given that the player wants to stay in Milan.”

replies.msg: Sporting Lisbon insist on Andre Silva. Laxalt's sale to Atalanta is on stand-by at the moment due to the Uruguayan's requests. Castillejo is among the players put on sale but it's difficult that he gets sold. Tomorrow he'll likely play from the start [Sky

Giampaolo: "We have been working hard but we are without some players. Normally during the preseason we have more time to develop the way you want to play. But with the players away we had less time to prepare."
Giampaolo: "The lads who were with us since the beginning have been working hard and did very well."
Giampaolo: "We prefer to have problems in the preseason so we can correct them. During the ICC we had different problems, we faced teams that use different systems of play. We did good things, we did things that were not as good. But this is all a part of the journey."
Giampaolo: "The most important thing is that the players follow my instructions and my ideas."
Giampaolo: "This is a fantastic chance for me and for the players. We are all involved in taking this great opportunity. We have everything we need to work hard and do well and there is a lot of passion around the team."
Giampaolo: "I have a vision, I know where we need to go & how we can get there."

Giampaolo: "We have been working on specific things. I might bring Bennacer on tomorrow but there are other players who offer better guarantees technically and tactically at the moment."
Giampaolo: "Tomorrow the team must be competitive. 11 players will take on the field not 11 cut-outs. They need to have the personality, the desire and determination to win."
Giampaolo: "I have coached Suso and I hope he can adapt to the way we want to play. Everyone considers him a winger because that's where he always played. Suso has been fully committed to the way we play. Offensive great players can play anywhere."
Giampaolo: "I am not worried about Piatek. He is a player with very specific characteristics. Having him isolated alone doesn't suit him much, he needs to player with a player next him otherwise he gets smothered by defense."
Giampaolo: "He is perhaps the player that struggled the most adapting to this system. He had his chances to score but failed and I'm not particularly worried about that. What I care about is the overall performance of the team. We need to create situation that allows us to win."
Giampaolo: "Piatek has an instinct to score and is a great finisher. The target is to get him as close as to scoring."
Giampaolo: "Correa? I don't know who he is."

Giampaolo: "I am very lucky to work with directors that were great players. They are well aware with how things should work. They know what needs to be done. I complain when there is a lack of attention or passion."
Giampaolo: "We will do what we can to create positive criticism. I work 1 hours a day, 12 at Milanello and 6 at home. In this job you cannot fear anything. This is a great opportunity and I'm ready for it, we have everything to create a positive atmosphere around the team."
Giampaolo: "Our objective is the Champions League but there are a lot of teams in the running for that race. A team of Milan's pedigree must compete for CL qualification. We are not here as extras we are here to do our best to achieve our goals."
Giampaolo: "I haven't heard from Gattuso but I know that he has a restaurant in Gallarate and soon I'll go find him."
Giampaolo: "I was very upset to lose Biglia. He is a very professional and serious player who has adapted well to our style of play, I was very happy with the way he was doing.Then there are players who are out for longer like Caldara and Theo. They're working to rejoin the team"
Giampaolo: "However there is a difference between being fit and being match fit so everything has to be evaluated."
Giampaolo: "Penalty taker? It will be Piatek."
Giampaolo: "I can't talk about the transfer market and don't think about it, I'd be wasting my energy. Like I said earlier, the directors know exactly what they need to do. They know if an opportunity arises what to do."

Giampaolo: "The derby? I want to see the perfect Milan at ever game not just the derby. From experience I know that sometimes you take 2-3 steps forward but at other times you take steps backwards. In the end it's always the players who make the difference."
Giampaolo: "We need to improve constantly. Of course we all need to pick up the right results."
Giampaolo: "Andre Silva has been affected by the rumors. He was sold then returned after his medical. But he is a Milan player I count on and he has been working hard. What happens in the future doesn't matter. I believe firmly in the professionalism of each of my players."
Giampaolo: "Correa? I don't know who he is."
Giampaolo: "I don't think the first three games will be decisive in anyway but they can certainly push morale. The judgement must be preserved for how you do the things."
Giampaolo: "Our work depends on other people's judgements and our results. We must continue on building team cohesion."
Giampaolo: "Leao and Duarte? They have been working hard but trained a little."
Giampaolo: "Correa? I don't know who he is."
